thread.title: Most Bizarre Celebrity Side Hustles, From Amber Rose's Strip Club to Paul Rudd's Candy Shop
thread.title_full: Most Bizarre Celebrity Side Hustles, From Amber Rose's Strip Club to Paul Rudd's Candy Shop

title: Most Bizarre Celebrity Side Hustles, From Amber Rose's Strip Club to Paul Rudd's Candy Shop
text:
Most Bizarre Celebrity Side Hustles, From Amber Rose's Strip Club to Paul Rudd's Candy Shop By Email Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images 
Some celebs buy or open restaurants to make extra money or just try something new. Some start production companies. 
And some go for the unusual. 
Amber Rose The glamour model announced this week she bought the Ace of Diamonds L.A. gentlemen's club. Rose, a former stripper, made the announcement Wednesday at the All Def Movie Awards while receiving the Vanguard Award for her activism and social justice work. She is the founder of the SlutWalk , a female empowerment protest march aimed at stopping rape culture. Read A post shared by ChyNLauren (@chyboog) on Feb 23, 2017 at 5:01am PST 
"I was a dancer, I was an exotic dancer, I was stripper for a very long time. Best time of my life, by the way. I had the time of my life. But do y'all know Ace of Diamonds? Well, I bought it," she said, drawing cheers. 
"I bought it," she said. "So this is to every girl out there, every stripper, ya'll can one day be on stage with Russell Simmons , receiving an award." 
Rose has hosted and attended many events at the club, which operates once a week. It is a favorite among celebs such as her ex Wiz Khalifa and fellow rappers Snoop Dogg , French Montana and Ty Dolla $ign . She gave no further details and club reps have not commented. Bryan Bedder/Getty Images for Moet & Chandon 
Scarlett Johansson In 2016, the actress opened a gourmet popcorn snack shop , the Yummy Pop eatery, in Paris. Flavors include truffle parmesan and olive oil, Canadian maple and chocolate strawberry. 
"It has been a dream of mine and my family for several years to bring our favorite American snack to our favorite European City!" the actress said in a statement. "I am so excited to introduce Yummy Pop, a labor of love and Epicurean enthusiasm. My hope is for Yummy Pop to become a Parisian snacking staple and a symbol of friendship between my two most beloved cities, Paris and New York." Getty Images 
Paul Rudd and Jeffrey Dean Morgan: The Ant-Man star co-owns a candy store, Samuel's Sweet Shop, with The Walking Dead 's villain Negan in the small town of Rhinebeck, New York, located about two hours north of Manhattan. 
The two, along with their wives, Julie Yaeger and Hilarie Burton , and another couple also involved with the entertainment industry, bought the business to save it from closing after longtime owner Ira Gutner died in 2014, USA Today reported. Rudd and Morgan live with their families in the area. 
Several months ago, Morgan promoted the candy store on TV, wearing a Samuel's baseball cap while appearing on the post- Walking Dead talk show Talking Dead and presenting a gift basket from the shop to Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show . 
"Why is Negan bringing me candy?" Fallon said. 
Morgan talked about the business, saying he and Rudd "have literally nothing to do with it, other than eating the candy." 
"The kids think it's fantastic," he added. Photos
